item.title: [Python] Othello game development made with Python
item.description: #Introduction I developed an Othello game using Python. Anyone can easily play github page https://github.com/chihina/othello-game-python Development environment python3.7.1 For other, please check requirement.txt on the following github page. https://github.com/chihina/othello-game-python Until the game starts First, execute git clone with the following command. git clone https://github.com/chihina/othello-game-python.git Next, install the libraries in a batch with the following command. pip -r install requirement.txt This concludes the environment construction. It’s easy. The following command will start the game.

item.title: [Python] Make a game UI from 1 with pygame2!
item.description: # Overview This article is the 14th day of Future Advent Calendar 2019. Yesterday’s article was written by @RuyPKG I want to have fun even with newcomers! ~Preparation of minutes~. @Shibukawa introduced the game engine at an in-house study session the other day, which is the reason why this article was written. I wanted a UI for a board game implemented in Python, and it was difficult to express movement in HTML, so I decided to try pygame, the Python game engine.
